result.execSummary:
The defendant Lasondra Q Hurt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber release for treatment and child care, credit for 150 days.

miscConds.notes:
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 4/18/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 4/18/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution is set at zero

-No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause
-No contact with DDA.

-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course

timeConds.notes: -20 days imposed and stayed to be used at the discretion of the agent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lasondra Q Hurt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lasondra Q Hurt in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
AS TO COUNT 1:
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements made by the State, Defense counsel and the defendant.
The Court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, Huber release for treatment and child care, credit for 150 days. IMPOSED and STAYED. The Court placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 YEARS.
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 60 DAYS in the House of Correction, Huber release for treatment and child care, credit for any days left from Count 1 (if any). IMPOSED and STAYED. The Court placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-20 days imposed and stayed to be used at the discretion of the agent
-No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course
-No contact with DDA. 
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 4/18/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 4/18/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution is set at zero 
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Incarceration Credit Form
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab
Scanned:  Order to Produce signed on 1/25/2016.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
Defendant  advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY to the amended charges. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Case calendared for SENTENCING in Branch 15.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Defendant Lasondra Q Hurt in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
The State filed an amended information charging:
COUNT 1: Misdemeanor Battery pursuant to Wis Stat 940.19(1), a class "A" Misdemeanor
COUNT 2: Disorderly COnduct pursuant to Wis Stat 947.01(1), a class "B" Misdemeanor  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO JUSTICE POINTwith drug testing, no use or possession of any controlled substances, no firearms or dangerous weapons, no contact with DDA, compliance with prescribed medications.

Defendant Lasondra Q Hurt in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Lasondra Q Hurt in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Based on the doctor's report and stipulation of both parties, Court finds that the defendant is competent to proceed and orders proceedings reinstated. Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA in Branch 15.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
The department is asking for a sooner date. Court is down the week of January 25 and the DA is unavailable this week. Case rescheduled for 2/1 at 8:30 am. sab
Department of Health Services Report dated 1-06-16 authored by Marshall Bates, MD, received and filed.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Defendant was brought back into court as high risk status. Defendant contested the doctor's findings. Testimony was taken from Dr. Collins. Based on the doctor's report, testimony and the behavior of the defendant, Court found the defendant not competent to proceed and not competent to refuse medications. Court ordered defendant committed to Behavioral Health Division. Order of Committment signed and filed. Copies give to the deputies for transport. Case calendared for STATUS in Branch 15. Court suspends proceedings.

Defendant Lasondra Q Hurt in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Lasondra Q Hurt in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Matter in Court on return of doctor's report. Doctor's report states that the defendant is not competent to proceed. Defendant started to become beligerent and profane. Defendant was removed from the court.  Status conference scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Lasondra Q Hurt not in court, in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant is unstable on todays date. Doctor's Report return is rescheduled to have the defendant produced and defense counsel to review the report with her.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Doctor's Report received and filed. sab

Defendant Lasondra Q Hurt in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Lasondra Q Hurt in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Return on bench warrant held. Court ordered defendant remanded into custody. Arguments by counsel.  Defense requests doctor's report return date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 15.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 10/8/2015. Bench Warrant in file.  Case is adjourned on 10/14/2015 at 8:30 a.m. for Return on Bench Warrant in Branch 15. Notice is given to Public Defender's Office and District Attorney.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj
Filed, Justice Point Report dated 10/2/2015.
Letter from Wisconsin Forensic Unit stating defendant did not show up for appointment received and filed.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Lasondra Q Hurt not in court.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Based on the defendant's non-appearance for her forensics appointment and based on the defendant's Justice Point violations, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.   COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court ordered signature bond forfeited.
MCPS VIOLATION REPORT, FILED
JusticePoint Violation (missed telephone contact), received and filed.  The Court takes no action at this time.
JusticePoint Violation Report (9-9-15 missed telephone contact), received and filed.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Defendant Lasondra Q Hurt in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Stats., Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit on 9/28/2015 at 1:00 pm in Room 504 of the Safety Building. Order For Competency Examination, signed and filed. Copy forwarded to the Forensic Unit. Court ordered case calendared for DOCTOR'S REPORT RETURN on 10/14/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions.
Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
STATE'S MOTION IN LIMINE, FILED
STATE'S REQUESTED JURY INSTRUCTIONS, FILED
Court denies defense request to reduce Justice Point monitoring level.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Defendant Lasondra Q Hurt in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Atty Harris was just appointed on this case and still needs an offer. Court vacates the trial date. Case calendared for STATUS on 9/2/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION FOR REDUCTION OF BAIL

Defendant Lasondra Q Hurt in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests a final pre-trial and trial date.   All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15,  in Room 502 of the Safety Building.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated 6/18/15 received and filed.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Lasondra Q Hurt not in court, in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense request for bail modification heard and granted.  The court will reinstate $250PR Bond with TOT Justice point.
Case is set for 6-22-2015 at 8:15 for scheduling.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Lasondra Q Hurt in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Lasondra Q Hurt in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Mark Peterson-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order/NO FIREARMS ORDER.  Defendant to have no contact with DDA, dob 8-20-1997, her family or 4707 N. 35th St.
TOT Justice point with drug testing

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Lasondra Q Hurt not in court, in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant returned on bench warrant on 5-23-2015.  Defendant failed to appear for preliminary hearing.  Court will set bail at $250.00 cash TOT Justice point with drug testing.  Case is adjourned to 6-11-2015 at 8:30 for preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Atty Stewart appeared at 11:15.  Case put over to 6-2-2015 at 8:15
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) ad
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court. Jeremy Arn for Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identifed, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Oral No Contact Order with DDA.

Defendant Lasondra Q Hurt in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold Defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
